Description: Body sherd (mended from three fragments) of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of end of Triton's tail; on the left, reserved ivy-leaf (filling ornament belonging to lost handle-palmettes); below, stopt maeander with chequer squares; relief-contour for Triton's tail.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as G138.44 and G138.45b. Beazley suggests that the picture perhaps represented Theseus visiting Poseidon.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0222) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 46, pl. L, no. 26)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
